Switch on the pH meter and calibrate the pH meter using pH 7 buffer.
Take a labeled beaker containing pH 7 buffer solution.
Place the beaker below the pH electrode and dip the electrode into the solution.
pH meter shows the reading as 7.0, now it is properly calibrated and is ready to be used.
Remove the pH 7 Buffer from pH meter.
Wash the electrode using distilled water and adjust the pH meter with pH 4.0 buffer solution.
Take a labeled beaker containing pH 4 buffer solution.
Place the beaker below the pH electrode and dip the electrode into the solution.
pH meter shows the reading as 4.0, now it is properly adjusted to the pH 4.
Remove the pH 4 buffer from the pH meter.
Remove the pH 4 buffer from the pH meter.
Wash the electrode using distilled water and adjust the pH meter with pH 9.0 buffer solution.
Take a labeled beaker containing pH 9.2 buffer solution.
Place the beaker below the electrode and dip the electrode into the solution.
Now the pH meter reads the pH as 9.2, which means the meter was adjusted to the pH 9.2
Remove the beaker from the pH meter.
Remove the beaker from the pH meter.
Place a 100 mL beaker above the electronic balance and adjust the balance reading to 00.0000.
Using a spatula add soil into it.
Weigh the 20g soil and remove the beaker from the weighing balance.
Measure 40 mL distilled water.
Add this 40 mL distilled water into the soil.
Mix this solution using a glass rod.
Mix this solution using a glass rod.
Allow this soil water suspension to stand for half an hour with intermittent stirring.
Wash the electrode using distilled water.
Take the beaker containing soil-water suspension.
Place the beaker below the pH electrode and dip the electrode into the solution.
pH value of soil sample is determined from the automatic display of the pH meter.
